summary_points: 1. David Zaslav's compensation will be significantly reduced to $15.5 million (first year) and $7.5 million annually thereafter, contingent upon the tax-free separation of Warner Bros. Discovery's divisions by December 31, 2026.
2.  92% of Zaslav's stock options will be forfeited if the division separation or a vaguely defined "Qualifying Transaction" does not occur before December 31, 2026.
3.  Numerous employment agreements for both Zaslav and Wiedenfels are included in the filing as of June 12, 2025, but specifics of Wiedenfels' compensation remain undisclosed.
1. Arista Networks, Inc. appointed Todd Nightingale as President and Chief Operating Officer, effective around July 1, 2025.
2.  Nightingale's compensation package includes a $350,000 annual base salary,  $30,000,000 in restricted stock units (RSUs), and $2,000,000 in performance-based stock units (PSUs).

3.  A severance agreement stipulates that Nightingale will receive 12 months of base salary and accelerated vesting of time-based equity awards if his employment is terminated involuntarily without "cause" or he resigns for "good reason."

1. At Monster Beverage Corporation's June 12, 2025 annual meeting, Mark S. Vidergauz received significantly fewer votes (733,750,723) than other board members, indicating potential concerns among shareholders.
2.  The ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as the independent auditor for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2025, passed with 873,478,275 votes for and only 790,395 votes against.

3. Shareholder approval of the named executive officers' compensation (Proposal No. 3) was advisory and passed with a significant number of votes against (55,307,300) indicating some investor dissent.
1. On June 13, 2025, Rob Berntsen, Xcel Energy's Executive Vice President, Chief Legal and Compliance Officer, resigned to pursue another opportunity.

2. Ryan Long was promoted to replace Berntsen, effective June 16, 2025, while simultaneously retaining his role as President of Northern States Power Company, pending an internal and external search for his successor.
3.  Xcel Energy is currently conducting an internal and external search for a new President for Northern States Power Company.

1. On June 16th, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery successfully amended its outstanding notes and debentures, eliminating most restrictive covenants and events of default (excluding those related to non-payment, insolvency, or cessation of guarantees).
2.  The amendment resulted in a significant variation in consent levels across different securities, ranging from 57.93% to 98.59%.
3.  New limitations on future debt repurchases and the addition of non-boycott provisions were included in the amended indentures.
1. On June 13, 2025, Starbucks Corporation entered into a new $3.0 billion, five-year revolving credit facility, maturing June 13, 2030, with an option to increase commitments by up to $1.0 billion.
2.  Starbucks terminated its previous credit agreement, dated September 16, 2021, in conjunction with the new agreement.

3. The new credit agreement includes covenants requiring Starbucks to maintain a minimum fixed charge coverage ratio of 2.50 to 1; failure to meet this covenant could result in lenders declaring outstanding amounts immediately due.
1. On June 11, 2025, Seagate Technology Holdings plc redeemed all outstanding 4.875% Senior Notes due 2027 at a redemption price of 100.819% of the principal amount, plus accrued interest.

2.  As of June 10, 2025,  between 61.49% and 95.39% of eight different series of outstanding senior notes were tendered for exchange in exchange offers, with the highest percentage tendered being for the 8.250% Senior Notes due 2029.

3.  Seagate intends to issue new notes under one or more indentures, eliminating substantially all restrictive covenants and certain default provisions from the existing indentures governing the old notes.

1. On June 11, 2025, Bunge Global SA amended its subsidiaries' revolving credit agreements, increasing available credit by $2.5 billion contingent upon governmental approval of its Viterra acquisition.

2.  The amendments increased Bunge Limited Finance Corp.'s credit line from $1.95 billion to $3.2 billion and Bunge Finance Europe B.V.'s from $1.75 billion to $3.5 billion, both also contingent on the Viterra acquisition approval.

3. The incremental commitments under both amended agreements are subject to immediate cancellation if the Viterra acquisition is not approved by the relevant Chinese authorities by December 31, 2025, or if the acquisition agreement is terminated before that date.

1. Becton, Dickinson and Company (BD) reached a proposed settlement in a stockholder derivative litigation concerning alleged misstatements about software defects in its Alaris infusion pump system, with a settlement hearing scheduled for August 11, 2025.
2.  The proposed settlement includes a $9,000,000 payment to BD from the defendants’ D&O insurance carriers, along with corporate governance modifications to be maintained for at least four years.
3. Plaintiffs' counsel will request $3,470,000 in attorneys' fees and expenses, and may request service awards for plaintiffs not exceeding $5,000 each, all to be paid from the settlement fund.
1. Motorola Solutions, Inc. closed a public offering of $2 billion in senior notes with maturities ranging from 2030 to 2035 on June 16, 2025.
2.  The offering comprised $600 million of 4.850% senior notes due 2030, $500 million of 5.200% senior notes due 2032, and $900 million of 5.550% senior notes due 2035.

3. The notes are part of the financing for Motorola Solutions' acquisition of Silvus Technologies Holdings Inc., and failure to complete this acquisition by May 22, 2026 (or a later agreed-upon date) will trigger mandatory redemption of the 2030 and 2032 notes at 101% of principal plus accrued interest.

1. Ingersoll Rand Inc.'s 2025 annual meeting on June 12, 2025, saw 383,328,167 shares (95.01%) voting, with results showing varying levels of support for director elections and executive compensation approval.
2.  All director elections received a majority "For" vote, though the percentage of "For" votes varied significantly between candidates, ranging from approximately 87% to 95%.
3.  Deloitte & Touche LLP was ratified as the independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2025 with 372,593,679 "For" votes and 10,060,952 "Against" votes.
